Description: Pay per token/API call processed (e.g., per 1K tokens)
Best For: LLM APIs, text generation, translation services
Advantages: Fair, direct cost correlation; scales with usage; low entry barrier
Disadvantages: Unpredictable costs; hard to forecast; can get expensive at scale

Description: Fixed monthly/annual fee with feature tiers (Basic/Pro/Enterprise)
Best For: General SaaS products with clear feature differentiation
Advantages: Predictable revenue; clear upgrade paths; easy to understand
Disadvantages: May not capture heavy usage value; shelfware risk

Description: Charge per user seat or active user
Advantages: Simple billing; scales with team size; predictable
Disadvantages: Doesn't reflect usage intensity; limits collaboration

Description: Pay only for what you consume (API calls, compute time, data processed)
Best For: Cloud services, APIs with variable consumption
Advantages: Maximum flexibility; pay only for use; transparent
Disadvantages: Cost unpredictability; hard to forecast for customers

Description: Free tier with limited features + paid premium tiers
Advantages: Low friction adoption; large user base; product-led growth
Disadvantages: High COGS for free users; low conversion rates (1-5%)

Description: Base subscription + additional charges for usage beyond allowance
Best For: AI services, developer tools, variable usage patterns
Advantages: Revenue predictability + flexibility; captures heavy users
Disadvantages: Complex to implement; requires sophisticated billing

Description: Price based on customer perceived value and business outcomes
Advantages: Maximizes revenue potential; aligns with customer ROI
Disadvantages: Hard to measure; requires deep customer understanding

Description: Pay for measurable results (resolved tickets, conversions, etc.)
Advantages: Perfect alignment of incentives; pay for results only

Description: Price per AI agent as a "digital worker" ($X per agent/month)
Best For: Autonomous AI agents replacing human tasks
Advantages: Easy to understand (like hiring); predictable costs
Disadvantages: AI costs can vary; may not reflect actual work done

Advantages: Simple to calculate; ensures cost recovery
Disadvantages: Ignores customer value; may underprice or overprice
